title: Web view core plug-in interferes
body:
### Bug Report Checklist

- [X] I have searched existing issues and this is not a duplicate
- [X] I have updated to the latest version of Vertical Tabs
- [X] I have disabled all other plugins and themes to ensure the issue is with Vertical Tabs
- [X] I have restarted Obsidian after disabling other plugins and themes, and the issue persists

### Environment (Optional)

- [ ] Windows
- [ ] macOS
- [X] Linux
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] iPadOS

### Bug Description

When I click on a URL in my note, the web page opens in Obsidian thanks to the Web View plug-in, but afterwards I need to disable and re-enable VT to make it work properly.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Obsidian
2. Enable the Vertical Tabs plug-in.
3. Open 2 or 3 notes
4. Open a URL from an Obsidian note.
5. Close that web page.
6. The VT pane is empty, no open tabs are shown.
7. Disable then re-enable VT.
8. Open tabs are visible again.

### Debug Information

RECOMMENDATIONS:

	Community plugins: for bugs, please first try updating all your plugins to latest. If still not fixed, please try to make the issue happen in the Sandbox Vault or disable community plugins.


### Can you reproduce the bug in the "Sandbox vault"? Please skip this for mobile platforms by selecting "Not applicable".

Yes

### Screenshots (Optional)

_No response_

### Additional Information (Optional)

I have VT set such that tabs are only visible in the side pane – can't remember how I did that.

In the sandbox, the tabs were show both vertically and horizontally. The vertical tabs show the same behavior as described above.

The horizontal ones show something different. The note with the URL is replaced by the webpage. When the web page is closed, the note with the URL remains closed, soyou have to open it with `CTRL+O`.
author: DutchPete

comments.body:
Hi @DutchPete ! This bug has been fixed and the next version will be publicly available soon.

> I have VT set such that tabs are only visible in the side pane – can't remember how I did that.

If I am correct, you should have enabled "Show active tabs only" in the settings. You can change that if you like.
Hi @DutchPete ! The updated version is now available.

title: Too easy to select a tab on mobile (iOS/iPadOS)
body:
I noticed that, if there are too much tabs opened (I know that is not a good way to proceed I hope you could forgive me) and you have to scroll the list, basically if the point on which you tap to scroll is the name of a tab, it will be selected after the scrolling ends.

To avoid it I started to tap on the name of a group when I would scroll to search if a tab is open (for instance) but I don't want to change the current tab.

This behaviour is evident on my iPhone and makes difficult to manage a long list of tabs on it, while on my iPad is not so noticeable but it is still here.
author: Azmoinal

comments.body: Thank you for reporting this bug! I'll try to fix it ASAP. Delivering a smooth mobile experience and handling a large number of tabs are the goal of this plugin.
Hi! Scrolling should work on mobile now ~ Please update to v0.10.0. If you encounter any problem, please reopen this issue. Thank you.
I can confirm that it works fine with latest update. Thanks a lot for the fix!
